metadata.title: CVE-2015-8382 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - low
metadata.description:
The match function in pcre_exec.c in PCRE before 8.37 mishandles the/(?:((abcd))|(((?:(?:(?:(?:abc|(?:abcdef))))b)abcdefghi)abc)|((*ACCEPT)))/pattern and related patterns involving (*ACCEPT), which allows remoteattackers to obtain sensitive information from process memory or cause adenial of service (partially initialized memory and application crash) viaa crafted regular expression, as demonstrated by a JavaScript RegExp objectencountered by Konqueror, aka ZDI-CAN-2547.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-8382` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libpcre3 - 1:8.31-2ubuntu2.2
libpcrecpp0 - 1:8.31-2ubuntu2.2
pcregrep - 1:8.31-2ubuntu2.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: pcre3 package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:8.31-2ubuntu2.2').
